use it as a resource to uphold the high standards of Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost, and

</s> <s=17> *SECTION 1: INTRODUCTION AND WELCOME*


</s> <s=13> *1.1 Welcome Message*


</s> <s=11> Welcome to the SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. team!


You are now part of a dynamic and ISO 9001:2015 QMS Certified company committed to
delivering reliable, compliant logistics solutions across the Philippines. Our success is driven by
our people—a skilled and experienced team dedicated to operational excellence. This manual is
your guide to our company's policies, culture, standards, and expectations. We trust that you will
*use it as a resource to uphold the high standards of Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost, and*
*Morale that define the Safexpress family.*


</s> <s=13> *1.2 Purpose of the Manual*


</s> <s=11> This manual serves as the definitive reference for all employees regarding the standards,
policies, and procedures of SAFEXPRESS LOGISTI

CS INC. Its purpose is to ensure a unified,
safe, and efficient working environment where every team member understands their role in
meeting customer expectations and achieving business objectives.


</s> <s=17> *SECTION 2: COMPANY OVERVIEW AND CORE*


*COMMITMENTS*


</s> <s=13> *2.1 Our Identity*


</s> <s=11> SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is a dynamic logistics company providing end-to-end supply
chain solutions, specializing in efficient warehousing, distribution, freight management,
transportation, and value-added services nationwide.


</s> <s=13> *2.2 Core Purpose*


</s> <s=11> *To be the driving force that optimizes, enhances, and empowers our clients' supply chains.*
*We are not just moving goods; we are moving growth and success all over the country.*
</s>

[PAGE=2]
<s=13> *2.3 Quality Policy (QMS)*


</s> <s=11> At SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC., we are committed to delivering reliable, compliant logistics
solutions that meet the highest standards of customer, interested parties, a

CS INC. Its purpose is to ensure a unified,
safe, and efficient working environment where every team member understands their role in
meeting customer expectations and achieving business objectives.


</s> <s=17> *SECTION 2: COMPANY OVERVIEW AND CORE*

</s> <s=13> *2.1 Our Identity*


</s> <s=11> SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is a dynamic logistics company providing end-to-end supply

transportation, and value-added services nationwide.


</s> <s=13> *2.2 Core Purpose*

</s>

solutions that meet the highest standards of customer, interested parties, a

[PAGE=1]
<s=23> *SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC.*


</s> <s=17> *HEALTH, SAFETY & ENVIRONMENT (HSE) MANUAL*


*SECTION 1: HSE POLICY & COMMITMENT*


</s> <s=13> *1.1 HSE Mission Statement*


</s> <s=11> SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is committed to providing a safe, healthy, and environmentally


*responsible workplace for all employees, contractors, and visitors. Our goal is Zero Accidents*


*and Injuries. We integrate Safety as the primary KPI in every operational decision, ensuring*


compliance with all Philippine laws and international standards for logistics and warehousing.


</s> <s=13> *1.2 Management Responsibilities*


</s> <s=11> Management is responsible for:


● *Providing necessary Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and ensuring its proper*


use.


● Conducting regular safety audits and risk assessments across all sites (warehouses,


yards, and fleet operations).


● Implementing corrective actions for all reported safety deficiencies and hazards.


</s> <s=13> *1.3 Employee R

<s=12> *Safexpress Logistics Inc.*


*Company Safety Rules & Regulations*


*1. General Safety & Conduct*


</s> <s=11> *Safety First: Safety is the primary Key Performance Indicator (KPI) in every decision.* •
</s> <s=12> The goal is Zero Accidents and Injuries.


</s> <s=11> *Adherence to Procedures: All employees must strictly adhere to all safety rules,* •
</s> <s=12> procedures, and Work Instructions (WI).


</s> <s=11> *Hazard Reporting: You must identify and report all potential hazards, near-misses,* •
</s> <s=12> and unsafe conditions immediately to your direct supervisor or the HSE Officer.


</s> <s=11> *Training Participation: Active participation in all safety training and drills is* •
</s> <s=12> mandatory.


*2. Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)*


</s> <s=11> *Mandatory Wear: Employees must wear the required PPE for their assigned tasks* •
</s> <s=12> and work areas at all times.


*Speciﬁc Requirements:*


</s> <s=11> *High Visibility Vests: Required at all

results.text: SECTION 2: COMPANY OVERVIEW AND CORE

[PAGE=1]
<s=17> *_ Standard _* *_ Operating _* *_ Procedure _* *_ (SOP) _* *_ for _* *_ Goods _*


*_ Receiving _*


</s> <s=11> _This procedure ensures that all incoming goods are handled efficiently, accurately, and safely,_
_adhering_ _to_ _the_ _Quality_ _Policy_ _and_ _preventing_ _stock_ _reconciliation_ _errors._


</s> <s=13> *_ 1.0 Purpose _*


</s> <s=11> _To establish a uniform and controlled process for the receipt, inspection, and recording of all_
_incoming cargo and materials, ensuring compliance with client instructions and minimizing_
_discrepancies._


</s> <s=13> *_ 2.0 Procedure Steps _*

[TABLE]
Step | Action | Responsibility | Quality/Safety Check
2.1 | Vehicle/Cargo
Check-in | Gate Guard /
Receiving Clerk | Verify the transporter's details against the
expected Delivery Order (DO) or Advanced
Shipping Notice (ASN). Check the vehicle
for signs of tampering or damage before
docking.
2.2 | Unloading
Preparation | Receiving
Supervisor | Clear the staging area. Ensure

with clients and partners must be professional, cooperative, and focused on solving their
needs.
● *Confidentiality: All company information, client data, inventory details, pricing*
structures, and operational strategies are strictly confidential and must not be disclosed
to unauthorized parties.


</s> <s=13> *3.2 Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE)*


</s> <s=11> Due to the nature of logistics, strict adherence to HSE protocols is mandatory.


● *Zero-Accident Policy: All personnel are required to follow safety procedures, wear*
appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) in designated areas (e.g.,
warehouses, yards), and report all hazards, near-misses, and incidents immediately.
● *Compliance: All transport operations must strictly adhere to local and national traffic*
laws and regulations. All warehouse operations must comply with industry safety
standards, particularly for Cold, Temperature-Controlled, and Ambient storage.


</s> <s=13> *3.3 Quality Management and Complia

standards, particularly for Cold, Temperature-Controlled, and Ambient storage.

[PAGE=3]
<s=13> *_ 4.0 Disaster Scenario: Major Power and Network Outage _*


</s> <s=11> *_ 4.1 Response and Activation _*


_1._ *_ Immediate Action: IC to declare Level 2 (Major Disruption). _*
_2._ *_ Communication: Activate satellite/backup communication devices. Notify all critical _*
_personnel via SMS/alternative channel._
_3._ *_ WMS/IT: IT Lead immediately switches to off-site cloud servers (if applicable) or initiates _*
*_ Backup & Recovery Procedure (Refer to IT Manual). _*


*_ 4.2 Logistics Continuity Protocol _*


_●_ *_ Dispatch: Switch to manual dispatch procedures using pre-printed Delivery Order (DO) _*
*_ and Bill of Lading (BOL) forms. Log all movements via secure chat groups. _*
_●_ *_ Warehouse: Halt all non-critical picking/packing. Receiving must be done manually, _*
*_ creating handwritten Receiving Reports. No movement of High-Value Cargo without _*
_dual sign-off._
_●_ *_ Data: Once systems are restored,

nd site
safety clearance. | HR Manager
[/TABLE]
</s>

[PAGE=3]

3.1 Code of Conduct and Professionalism 
All employees are expected to conduct themselves with the highest degree of professionalism, 
integrity, and respect. 
●  Client-Centricity: We put our clients at the core of our day-to-day lives. All interactions 
with clients and partners must be professional, cooperative, and focused on solving their 
needs. 
●  Confidentiality: All company information, client data, inventory details, pricing 
structures, and operational strategies are strictly confidential and must not be disclosed

pment (MHE) Operation*


</s> <s=11> ● *Only certified and authorized personnel are permitted to operate forklifts and other*


MHE.


● Maximum speed limits within the warehouse must be strictly observed.


● *Pedestrian right-of-way must be maintained; pedestrians must use designated*


walkways.


● *Forklifts must be inspected prior to every shift (Pre-Operation Check).*


</s> <s=13> *2.3 Storage and Racking Safety*
</s>

[PAGE=3]
<s=11> ● *Never exceed the documented maximum load capacity of the racking system.*


● Clearance must be maintained around fire exits, fire fighting equipment, and electrical


panels.


● Pallets must be stable, properly wrapped, and the load must not extend beyond the


edges of the pallet.


</s> <s=17> *SECTION 3: TRANSPORTATION & FLEET SAFETY*

[PAGE=1]
<s=17> *_ Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Plan (BCDRP) - _*


*_ Excerpt _*


</s> <s=11> _This document is designed to ensure that SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. can maintain critical_
_operations and quickly resume standard functions following a significant disruption or disaster._


</s> <s=13> *_ BCDR Plan: SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. _*

[TABLE]
Section | Title
Document No. | BCDR-001
Date Issued | November 2025
Revision | 1.0
Applicability | All Head Office and Branch Operations
[/TABLE]

*_ 1.0 Introduction and Policy _*


</s> <s=11> _The primary objective of this BCDR Plan is to minimize the impact of unforeseen events (natural_
*_ disasters, system failures, power outages, etc.) on our core logistics services (Safety, Quality, _*
*_ Delivery). We commit to the protection of personnel, client cargo, and vital business data, _*
_ensuring an acceptable level of service continuity._


</s> <s=13> *_ 2.0 Critical Business Functions (CBFs) and Recovery Objectives _*


</s

Achievements/Responsibilities: - Served as Project Manager for a bakeshop attendance and salary computation web application (MERN stack), leading end-to-end project execution from client consultation to delivery, gathering and validating requirements, contributing to system architecture and business logic, evaluating technical approaches, resolving design issues, managing tasks via Trello, coordinating stakeholder communication, preparing SPMP/SRS/SDD documentation, and performing comprehensive scenario-based manual testing to ensure system quality and alignment with project standards.
